page.title: 07Martello Towers
page.content: { Martello Towers}got this name because in Corsica in the{Bay of Mortella}a tower with one gun fought off two English warships. They were built to defend England against{Napoleon.}The towers were built between 1805_1812. The walls are 13 feet thick on the seaward side. The towers are 20_30 feet tall and the door is situated 10 feet up the wall. The person inside let down a ladder for people to get in. The towers were supposed to be cheap but they weren't;they cost Â£3000 each to build. The towers were built with a quarter of a million bricks; enough bricks to build thirty-four 4 bedroom houses. In the basement there is a magazine, store and an oil lantern. On the first floor are 3 rooms 2 soldiers quarters with twenty four soldiers and one officers room with one officer in it.
